result.name: front-street-improvements
result.notes:
Front Street is an important high street in Acomb, York. It plays a vital role in the community and the wider city and is home to many established and well-loved local independent retailers and community spaces.        

There has been a long-standing desire to undertake place making improvements to enhance the economic growth of this shopping area. In recent years, UK Shared Prosperity Funding has been received from central government to enhance, develop and support a more resilient high street in Acomb.                                        

Find out more at [__City of York Council's website__](https://www.york.gov.uk/AcombFrontStreet).

The landlord survey regarding the "Acomb Front Street Adopted and Privately Maintained Highway Footpath Areas" ran between March 2023 and September 2023. The Phase 2 survey took place in March 2024 to explore how the second phase of this money could best be spent. 

The council’s Executive considered an update report on [__18 July 2024__](https://democracy.york.gov.uk/ieListDocuments.aspx?CId=733&MId=14499&Ver=4) and approved progression of the detailed Phase 2 design. See the [__Front Street update report__](https://democracy.york.gov.uk/documents/s177468/Acomb%20Front%20Street%20Report.pdf), which included an outline of the high level principles of the Phase 2 scheme.  An executive summary of the [__feedback from the March public engagement__](https://democracy.york.gov.uk/documents/s177469/Annex%20A%20Executive%20Summary%20Engagement%20Feedback.pdf) accompanied the report.
